medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute pain and swelling in the first metatarsal-phalangeal joint (podagra).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. R experienced his first episode of podagra in 1993, which presented as sharp pain in his great toe, severe enough to require hospitalization. Over the next 10 years, he had recurrent episodes with uric acid levels rising as high as 9 mg/dL. He has had no recurrent symptoms since starting allopurinol treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of podagra, hyperuricemia, mild chronic kidney disease, obesity, hyperlipidemia, coronary artery disease with stent placement in 2000, and diabetes mellitus onset in 2007.
medical_history.family_history: Grandfather and father had renal disease of uncertain etiology; no family history of gout.
medical_history.social_history: 60-pack-year history of smoking; does not abuse alcohol or other drugs; worked as an engineer and is now retired; lives with his wife and has several children.
